alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Coastal Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 18 at 3:44AM EST until February 19 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...North to northeast winds 20 mph and gusty behind a cold front will produce a strong southward flowing longshore current and rough surf in the surf zone. A Moderate Risk of rip currents will also exist at area beaches today. * WHERE...Beaches of Volusia, Brevard, Indian River, Saint Lucie and Martin counties. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Longshore currents can knock swimmers off their feet or into deeper water, making them more susceptible to dangerous rip currents. The longshore current will also increase the risk of rip currents near piers and jetties.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
